'Bowdoin College' , founded in 1794, is a private liberal arts college located
in the coastal Maine town of Brunswick. The college enrolls approximately 1,700
students and has been coeducational since 1971. It offers 33 majors and 4
additional minors, and the student-faculty ratio is 9:1. Famous alumni include
Nathaniel Hawthorne, Henry Wadsworth Longfellow, Franklin Pierce, and Joshua
Chamberlain. It is a highly selective liberal arts college. The 2013 annual
ranking of [[U.S. News & World Report]] ranks it the 6th best liberal arts
college in the nation  and it is ranked 14th on [[Forbes]] magazine's
list of America's Top Colleges.

Bowdoin is located on the shores of Casco Bay and the Androscoggin River, north
of Freeport, Maine, and north of Portland, Maine. In addition to its Brunswick
campus, Bowdoin also owns a 118-acre (478,000 mÂ²) coastal studies center on Orrs
Island and a 200-acre (809,000 mÂ²) scientific field station on Kent
Island in the Bay of Fundy.
